headline: Restaurant-Style Chicken Nachos
description: Chicken nachos are easy to make with your favorite tortilla chips, shredded chicken, salsa, tomato, and cheese for a great meal or snack to share!
name: Restaurant-Style Chicken Nachos
recipeIngredient: 6 green onions, sliced, white parts and tops separated
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar/Monterey Jack cheese blend

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat oil in a deep 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add white parts of the green onions and garlic; cook and stir until onions are just tender. Mix in shredded chicken, salt, and pepper; toss until well coated. Stir in salsa.
Arrange tortilla chips on a large baking sheet. Spoon chicken mixture over tortilla chips; top with shredded cheese and tomato.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese has melted, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onion tops before serving.

review.reviewBody: Great base recipe, even better if you jazz it up with adding black beans, frozen corn and a little seasoning (like taco seasoning) to the chicken mixture. Speaking of chicken, I used plain rotisserie chicken, quick and easy! After you remove from oven and plate it, add toppings like fresh sliced jalapeno's, cilantro, guacamole (store bought is fine), and sour cream. A squeeze of fresh lime juice after it's plated really made it special too! With the tweaks, it was absolutely amazing, will make again and again!
I use white meat from a rotisserie chicken to make it easier. I also used cherry tomatoes and sliced up black pitted olives. We love this.

This recipe is worth every bit of 5 stars, it is delicious! Nachos, I don't care if they are chicken or beef, are a blank slate, and begin with a great basic recipe such as this one, which establishes great flavors. Then it's up to you and your family to customize with what you enjoy. Each of my family members customizes this basic recipe I make first as they like it and pop their version into the air fryer and, viola! I won't bore you with our customizations. This recipe is a 5 star "go to" for us!
Loved this recipe! I added corn and refried beans, and taco seasoning to the chicken per other reviews. I also used canned chicken, which worked just fine. Delicious! Will definitely be making again.
I gave this recipe a slight twist. I added spinach, black olives, refried beans and assorted Mexican cheese.
This is my son's absolute favorite dinner. So yummy!
This didn’t get 5 stars because the chips burned and the directions weren’t very clear so we had to add our own touches
Only made one change. Swapped out the olives for homemade pickled jalapeno peppers.
We love this recipe/method for shredding the chicken!

Yummy way to use leftover store bought rotisserie chicken. Very good recipe!

Tip 1: use a sturdy dinner fork to shred chicken while it's still cold (right out of the refrigerator)

Tip 2: be careful when seasoning; store bought rotisserie chicken's are normally already well-seasoned

Thank you!
Simple, too simple for me, but that's just the beginning, read the constructive reviews. I made a masterpiece from a good solid base.

Love it. Took several of the extra comments and tweaked it.
We love making this, it is mostly the same when we do make it, but nothing is ever the same twice when we cook. That is what makes cooking sooooo fun.
it was very good, my husband and kids loved it as well as I. simple and easy to make , will be making it again.
Did veggie Nachos - I know lame but #delish
Dbray, get your own recipe and post it. This recipe was awesome, 5*s! It is a good starter recipe to be versatile also, allows you to add whatever you feel to it.
I really did not want to cook and then I made this. Except I made it into a layered dip instead of putting the chips in the oven. Good dinner with minimal prep.
Adding beans (refried or black), red pepper and taco seasoning, as suggested in other reviews helped make it great
I took suggestions from others -- used taco seasoning, par-baked the chips, and it turned out really well.
Excellent!
They were just as good the next day when reheated in the toaster oven.
We really enjoyed this. Just bumped up the heat , only change made .

Family loved this. Loved how the chips were not soggy like on some other nacho recipe. Very versatile on toppings, you can add anything. Next time like others suggested I’m trying it with taco season mix and black beans. Definitely make again.

Very nice nacho recipe. Making a chicken mixture is key to helping the nachos have a cohesive flavor. Some of the most helpful comments improve this dish: Cook chips in oven for 5 minutes before assembling nachos (prevents sogginess with chicken mixture), add taco seasoning to the chicken mixture, top nachos with corn/black olives/green part of green onions. These changes improve the dish without extra hassle.
Great Nachos !!!!!

I must admit to planning social gatherings simply as an excuse to make this. Everyone loves it! I add fresh sliced mushrooms just before putting it in the oven. Not necessary, since the recipe is fantastic as is, but I feel there's not alot that can't be improved by mushrooms!

Super yummy recipe! I made this recipe with mostly what I had on hand. I agree with the recommendation to use rotisserie chicken. I mixed the chicken with Kirkland's salsa (from Costco)- just enough salsa to cover the chicken. Agree with the review to heat the chips first 5 minutes. I warmed up frozen broccoli, corn, red peppers on a separate tray & dumped them on top of the warmed chips. Then I put drained black beans (3/4 a can) and Trader Joe's 3 type mixed shredded cheese. Put sea salt & red pepper flakes on top. Heated in oven @375 until cheese was melted. I put a few black pieces on top, but I won't do that, again... too overpowering. When done, scoop sour cream on top. Yum!
Incredible. This is a perfect way to use leftover chicken! I served
Fantastic!
I added half a package of taco seasoning to the chicken and baked the nachos for 5 min. prior to adding everything. Awesome meal for 3 or 4. Thank you for the recipe!
Very flavorful. Both my husband and 4year-old daughter gave 5 stars. Thanks for sharing this recipe!
Delicious!
Had this a week ago and the wife has requested it again. Yes it was very good. This time though I am going to use ground pork vs the chicken, other than that recipe as is.
I made this and it was great. I heated the chips at 350 for 10 minutes before I put the meat on them. Also I used ground chicken and used taco seasoning on the chicken.
added taco seasoning to the chicken mixture, added refried beans, used a whole rotisserie chicken and deleted the salsa. Really good!
Maybe DH and I just don't like chicken nachos but these left both of us unimpressed; will remove from our meal rotation

Quick and easy recipe! I added my own seasoning to chicken and added other toppings like jalapeños, black olives and a dollop of sour cream. Overall good recipe and will make again with more toppings.

Turned out great! I added taco seasoning to ground beef. Baked in oven with Mexican cheese for 5 minutes. Added toppings to myself and my husbands likings. Would've been better with queso cheese, but I couldn't convince my husband to want it. Otherwise I will make again.
they're ok
Great recipe. Made it as stated but skipped chicken since my daughter is a vegetarian. Have made it several times and will definitely continue to be a recipe rotating in my schedule!

Deelish! Very easy to make! Start out with authentic tortilla chips if possible, not those totally salty ones like Tostitos. Next time I will follow others' advice and add taco seasoning to the chicken mixture. I'd also add more cheese than what they called for and black beans too. Some people suggested that you should heat up the chips for 5 minutes before spooning on chicken mixture to keep em crunchy/crisp. Next time I will put them under the broiler for the last 2-3 minutes. Great with beer!
Great easy recipe!

This was so easy and delicious! I only added some lime juice to the salsa and put black olives on top of the nachos, which is actually shown on the photo, and they were super awesome! I wish I had read the reviews first, you really do need to cover the pan with foil and bake the nachos a bit first. Otherwise the chips will be soggy! Also if you add 10 ingredients and make cheese sauce, you have changed the recipe! Thanks for an easy delicious recipe idea.
Very good and quick and easy to make.
When I do this everyone says that it is great. The amount of times I have to give people the recipe!!
This was a perfect use of leftover rotisserie chicken. I loved it. It's absolutely delicious.

So good. I added a small can of sliced black olives and a half bag of southwest style corn to the chicken mixture. I also heated a can of refried beans with about a half cup of salsa for the first layer over the chips. Two of us could have devoured the entire recipe, but we showed some restraint and saved half for the next day. Will definitely make again.

Phenomenal! I made this exactly as directed (flatten chicken w/ mallet to 1/2", boil 10 min, let cool/rest 5 min, shred w/ two forks), and added jalapeños and sliced black olives. I think the ones that say they needed to add taco seasoning must not have let the chicken and salsa reduce enough. I simmered the shredded chicken and salsa mixture about 20 minutes until the juice had JUST simmered out, leaving a dry-ish mixture so as not to let the cops get soggy. Using slightly preheated cast iron fajita pans I added the chips, baked 5 min, added about 1/3 of the cheese to melt another 5 minutes (this keeps all the wetter ingredients separated from the chips), then added the chicken, remainder of the cheese, and the rest of my toppings. Let cook another 5-8min, then remove, add chopped green onions, let rest a few minutes, throw a dollop of Greek yogurt (SC replacement) on the edge of the pile, and viola! Better than ANY restaurant nachos, by FAR! All in all, I did NOT modify this recipe, just added Jalapeños and black olives along with a refined cooking technique based on others reviews. AMAZING, thank you for this recipe!
AWESOME!!!
Absolutely without a doubt the best nachos ever!!!! Taco seasoning and jalapeño peppers added really kicked it up... I will never look for the best anymore. I've found it!!!!!

YUM - just needs sprucing up to call it "dinner". Added taco seasoning and a dash of Frank's Red Hot to the chicken while cooking to give it some zing. Drained and rinsed a can of black beans, drained a can of corn, added olives, salsa, sour cream, etc. Instead of baking and dealing with the mess, I make these on individual plates like this: Layer of chips, sprinkle shredded cheese on them, spoon on corn and beans, add chicken if it cooled off, and microwave about 20-30 seconds. When done, add your cold ingredients, sprinkle on more cheese, and enjoy!
It was fantastic! We will add sour cream and Bach cheese next time, but this as definitely a score for mom tonight!
Delicious! I used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream, I also had Doritos on hand and used those instead.
very good,

My husband and I really enjoyed this. I sauteed the onion and garlic with taco seasoning per others' suggestions, but I did have to add quite a bit of water because it was very thick. I also added some rotisserie chicken to the seasoning towards the end for a nice coating. Toasting the chips beforehand gave it a really nice crunch. We will definitely be having this again!
This is one recipe that is easy to make and DELICIOUS! The first time I made it, seconds and thirds were eaten. I was even asked to make it again tonight.

Before I discuss this recipe, let me mention the few small changes I made, just in case. One-I used garlic powder instead of garlic cloves. Two-I left out the onions and tomato, because my family and I don't like them. Three-I left out the oil and the salt for health purposes. Now let me mention the two small changes I would recommend to others: 1, definitely use more than a cup of salsa and 2, use even MORE cheese. These are supposed to be nachos, after all (I used a 16 oz jar of salsa and a bag and a half of 8 oz cheese, and it still needed more of both). Also, I used two chicken breasts, but would probably recommend three (all this was cooked in a casserole dish for my husband and I). Now, having said all that, this recipe was absolutely, 100%, amazingly INCREDIBLE! We turned it into a meal. Put it on a real plate, used a fork, broke the chips, and ate it like a taco salad. Didn't have anything else with it, and it was still super filling. SO tasty--really hit our Mexican food-craving spot. Most DEFINITELY will become a staple in our house. In fact, I will probably make it again next week! Can't say enough about it. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! Would give it 6 stars, if I could!

This was so very good! I too toasted the tortilla shells for 5 minutes in the oven, helped to keep them crisp.
And I added rinsed black beans and some frozen corn to add more texture as another reviewer suggested.
And one other thing I did was add a packet of taco seasoning to the chicken as it heated. Thank you for this
Great recipe! Will be making it again!
We do this anytime the girls have a sleepover and it always a crowd pleaser!

I used coconut oil instead of canola since coconut is healthier for us. I also did not go by the recipe because it would not have been as flavorful. Added 1/2 pkg. of taco seasoning in with chicken as I cooked it in pan with green onions. I used rotisserie chicken and I added can of refried black beans in with chicken. Also added sweet frozen kernel corn. I used whole bag 13 oz. of tortilla chips and put in Lg. glass Pyrex baking dish and sprayed with nonstick spray. I also added a little mozzarella cheese on top of Colby/ mont/jack cheese. Used a fresh salsa I found at Wal-Mart deli and 1/4 jar of mild salsa in jar. Used sour cream as dip on side. The corn really made this so much better and we thought it was really good and ate it as our dinner. The tortilla chips were not soggy either.
Amazing! Read the reviews and made minor adjustments/enhancements. Delicious!!!

I put this in my recipe box a year and a half ago and I make it still, its so good. DELISH!

Just don't let it sit too long or the nachos get soggy.

We added more seasonings to the chicken...cumin, onion and garlic powders, cayenne...and added a layer of refrieds to the pre-baked chips before topping with everything else. Thanks for the inspiration. These were really good!

Great base for Nachos. This recipe is great on its own but can be dressed up to your taste. I would suggest adding items such as sour cream, olives, diced tomato, or even refried beans to spice it up to what your family likes.

I used this recipe as more of a guide. I cooked some chopped rotisserie chicken with the white parts of green onions, garlic and a little bit of salsa in olive oil. I topped the chips with that mixture, some black beans, some diced pickled jalapenos and cheddar cheese and baked it on a baking sheet until the cheese was melted. Then I topped with plain Greek yogurt (in lieu of sour cream), the green onion greens and more salsa and these were THE BEST nachos I have ever made at home!! They were definitely restaurant quality, which I credit to cooking the "filling" mixture before baking it, which I never would have thought to do otherwise. Thank you!!
I have made this several times but use ground beef or ground turkey instead of chicken. Love it every time!

I didn't use the green onion, because heaven forbid my son, Mr. Pickypants, find something green on his plate! Knowing the chicken would be bland without it, I sprinkled with chicken with taco seasoning instead. Mr. Pickypants ate his unadorned, just chicken, cheese, and chips; after baking, I loaded mine with tomato, avocado, and shredded lettuce. We both really enjoyed them, and I will definitely make them again - thanks for sharing this recipe! 9.2.2013: I chopped the chicken finely instead of shredding it, which was a lot easier for me. I didn't have Cheddar/Jack, so I shredded a little mozzarella and some American cheese and tossed them together with a fork. That may sound awful, but this was THE BEST batch of these nachos I've made so far!

Sooo good & easy to make. I made this for a light dinner one night. The only change I made was using a large can of canned white chicken rinsed well. I used frontera green salsa which blended well with the other ingredients esp the garlic. My only addition was healthy avocados diced on the side before serving. I have been craving this practically every night for dinner since the first time I made it. A keeper!

My boyfriend absolutely loves nachos so when I came across this recipe, I knew I had to try it. I made it as described, with the exception of using 2 tbsp. of homemade taco seasoning ("Taco Seasoning I" on this site); and I used a rotisserie chicken (shredded up) versus the canned version.

Ease of prep: it couldn't get any easier! I think shredding the chicken took the longest but it was worth it! The shredded chicken felt smoother in your mouth versus chunks of chicken, but I believe it's personal preference. 

Ease of putting the meal together: again, it could not be easier! I do feel that you need more Mexican seasonings to make it taste more authentic, though. 

Overall: DELICIOUS!! Or as my teenage son would say, "Nom nom nom!", This will be a staple in my household!

Side note: I doubled the recipe and used an entire bag of Tostito's...layered it on a 9x13 cookie sheet (lined with foil). When it was done, the first thing I thought was this would be PERFECR for a football party!!

This was great! My family LOVED it and went back for seconds...and thirds! I did toast the chips in the oven for ten minutes before I added the toppings. I also used chicken breasts (shredded.) I took other reviewers advice and warmed everything up and just put everything on top of chips with no need to put the whole thing back in the oven. It was better than any other nacho recipe I've had. Thank you for a great recipe!
I followed some tips from lyssador when I made this recipe and it is delicious. I make this a lot, and sometimes use the leftovers to make quesadillas. Better than restaurant

I marinated chicken in Easy Chicken Fajita Marinade, and then I grilled it for this recipe, which is fabulous! I omitted all the canola oil just to lower the calories and don't think it was missed at all. I did use a good quality chunky salsa, which I think is imperative. I will definitely fix this again.
Great recipe. For added kick I used hot salsa. If you want beans make them as a side to keep the nachos from getting soggy.

I have made this twice. The first time with Taco flavored ground beef, and the second time with Fajita flavored chicken. I cook the chips for about 2min before to make them super crispy as well as adding black beans and jalapeno slices. My family LOVES the recipe!

This recipe is amazing! We have it nearly once a week. I always add taco seasoning to the chicken mixture, and saute yellow onions with the garlic (don't usually have green onions on hand). It really is as good as restaurant nachos!
These nachos were better than those I tasted in restaurants!! I used my mom's homemade salsa and they came out great. Would recommend doubling for a family of 4, though!
This was really good. Crisped up the tortillas in the oven and seasoned the chicken with taco seasoning. Served with sour cream and guacamole. Easy and delish!
I cook the chicken in taco seasoning. I garnish with avocado slices, black olives, chopped cilantro, sour cream. Serve with refried beans, Mexican rice, and chiffonade iceberg lettuce.

I wasnt sure how to add to my previous review so I thought I would do it this way. I did take the other suggestions and baked my chips in the oven by themselves for just a little bit. They were not soggy at all!!
yummy

This was excellent! I was looking for a good nacho base recipe that was still something a little more than just dumping chicken and toppings on some chips and this did that. I liked the use of the onions two ways, they served very separate purposes. I did throw a little homemade taco seasoning (bill echols' from this site) on the chicken while cooking because I like extra spice and I put that on just about everything. Next time I will add olives, black beans and jalapenos to customize it a bit for us. Thank you!
The absolute best chicken nachos ever!

I made it as written and it was delicious! I did add a little cumin and crushed red peppers to the chicken in the skillet and I crisped the chips for 5 minutes before adding the chicken and cheese, per another reviewer's suggestion. This was a big hit with my teenagers. It's a keeper!

Thank you for sharing your recipe. I thinking about making something since football season started and came upon this recipe, which was PERFECT :) My husband LOVED it. I did add ground cumin, garlic powder, sea salt, ground black pepper, refried beans,jalepenos & rotissere chicken as other suggested. It's a KEEPER :)

Since I can never just use the recipe I'm given I modified this. I used a rotisserie chicken for the shredded chicken and prepared it the same way (with the garlic and green onions). I however didn't use a cup of salsa, I instead spooned it on, until it covered the chicken but didn't overwhelm it. I also added a little bit of cayenne pepper and some paprika. I then layered the chips, making sure they didn't overlap then I sprinkled cheese on it, and then I put the chicken mixture on and put monterey cheese on top. Then I added more chips and repeated the process. Put it in the oven, let it bake. Then the last 5 minutes I put the tomatoes on and let it bake another 5 minutes. Then a couple minutes after I broiled it to get the cheese and chips to brown a little. Then I took it out, sprinkled it with green onions and squeezed sour cream on to it. Served it with salsa on the side. It turned out great! Cheaper than going out and probably healthier.
I made the shredded chicken by boiling with water and sofrito and this was yummy!

Family loved this tonight. I used extra lean ground chicken instead of shredded chicken breast. I seasoned the ground chicken with Homemade Taco Seasoning Mix from this site and also used Nacho Cheese Sauce from this site to top the nachos. I used some tortilla chips and some leftover doritoes...this was very easy, tasty and we also added a lil low fat sour cream as well. Thanks!
I have made this several times now and it is always a hit with the kids. I sometimes substitute seasoned ground turkey for the chicken and it is also good.

I used a Rotisserie chicken and mixed it in with some taco seasoning, garlic powder, black beans, and only a little salsa to moisten it up some. I didn't have onions or garlic on hand so didnt use them. I heated up the chips like other reviewers had said, and in about 8 minutes I had delicious nachos!
Good, but nothing exceptional. Can make this with less work but using the microwave I'd think.
good, easy
Everyone loved it! I did add taco seasoning to the chicken after I shredded it, but other than that stayed true to the recipe.
Pretty good, thank you.
This was a great recipe. The only thing I did differently, was season the chicken with a southwest seasoning first. Will definitely make again.
was great. will fix this often
yummmm! my kids just loved it! so easy to prepare and delicious. makes a good starter.
i cooked 2 chicken breasts and 1 can of black beans in 1/2 cup home made salsa until chicken was cooked through. these were delicious and everyone even the picky 8 year old gobbled them up!

I grilled my chicken (10-12 tenders) after tossing it in oil and "Pampered Chef Chipotle Rub". I followed the recipe to the tee but I layered the ingredients as follows so there were no naked chips!: chips, cheese, chicken mixture, tomato, cheese, and then one more layer of that. After ten minutes in the oven and a few minutes under "broil'' at 350 it was done to perfection! I plated it and topped it with a few more diced toms, chopped green onions, a little more salsa, and sour cream. It was delicious and everyone went back for seconds! Way better then any restaurant nachos I have ever had!
This was a delicious confort food dish. I made a vegan version using Weststoy cubed seitan. Aside from that, I followed the recipe as is, except I added a bit of "Mexican spices" seasoning.
we all loved it very tasty folowed recipe to the T.no changes needed ,delish as is.will make again and again its a keeper thank you for sharing
